meanings.definition: Resembling a disc in shape or form.
meanings.sent1: The moon looked discoid in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The discoid cookie was perfectly round and flat.
meanings.sent3: The discoid pizza was so flat, it could have been mistaken for a frisbee.
meanings.sent4: Her discoid hat cast a perfect circle of shade on her face.
meanings.sent5: The discoid mirror reflected her image in a perfect round shape.

meanings.definition: A flat, circular object or shape.
meanings.sent1: He found a shiny discoid on the beach while searching for seashells.
meanings.sent2: The discoid of the vinyl record gleamed under the light.
meanings.sent3: The discoid of cheese on the pizza was perfectly melted and gooey.
meanings.sent4: The discoid of the sun rose slowly over the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The discoid of the coin glinted in the sunlight.
